SENT.plain: Essential thrombocytosis (ET) is an uncommon pediatric hematologic disorder that can result in thrombotic complications, including cerebral venous sinus thrombosis (CVST)
Although CVST associated with ET is exceedingly rare, it can be devastating to the patient
We here report a pediatric case of CVST associated with ET
The patient was treated with hydroxyurea and warfarin, which was later replaced by low-dose aspirin
Platelet counts were well controlled after 16 months of follow-up, and no further thrombotic events occurred
Mucositis was the main adverse effect of treatment
